com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.layout

Class GridLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.layout.GridLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LayoutManager, Serializable

    public class GridLayout
extends Object
implements LayoutManager
    GridLayout is a LayoutManager that emulates GridLayout.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Yiannis Paschalidis
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GridLayout

        public GridLayout(int rows,
                  int cols)
        Creates a grid layout with the specified number of rows and columns.

        One, but not both, of rows and cols can be zero, which means that any number of objects can be placed in a row or in a column.

        Parameters:
        rows - the rows, with the value zero meaning any number of rows.
        cols - the columns, with the value zero meaning any number of columns.

      • GridLayout

        public GridLayout(int rows,
                  int cols,
                  int hgap,
                  int vgap)
        Creates a grid layout with the specified number of rows and columns.

        In addition, the horizontal and vertical gaps are set to the specified values. Horizontal gaps are placed at the left and right edges, and between each of the columns. Vertical gaps are placed at the top and bottom edges, and between each of the rows.

        One, but not both, of rows and cols can be zero, which means that any number of objects can be placed in a row or in a column.

        All GridLayout constructors defer to this one.

        Parameters:
        rows - the rows, with the value zero meaning any number of rows
        cols - the columns, with the value zero meaning any number of columns
        hgap - the horizontal gap between the columns, measured in pixels.
        vgap - the vertical gap between the rows, measured in pixels.

    • Method Detail

      • getHgap

        public int getHgap()
        Returns:
        Returns the horizontal gap between the cells, measured in pixels.

      • getVgap

        public int getVgap()
        Returns:
        Returns the vertical gap between the cells, measured in pixels.

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Returns:
        the number of rows, or 0 for a dynamic number of rows based on the number of components and columns.

      • getCols

        public int getCols()
        Returns:
        the number of columns, or 0 for a dynamic number of column based on the number of components and rows.
